org.jpws.pwslib.data

Class PwsRecordList

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecordList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<PwsRecord>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PwsFile, PwsIgDupRecordList

    public class PwsRecordList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<PwsRecord>
    Identification
    Top level structure of this library to represent a list of PWS records (PwsRecord). Each instance carries a unique identifier (UUID) which is supplied automatically but can be set through the interface. There is a second identifier which is a static instance counter value. The latter is meant for testing purposes only to discriminate instances in cases where UUIDs could be identical on various instances. This value is not operational for any programmatic context; it appears, however, on several Log messages of this class.

    Containment Logic
    The restriction on record entries is that they must be unique in the list, measured on their UUID values. The list has a "natural ordering" present, which is the ascending order of the UUID values of the elements. The reaction to duplicate insertion attempts can be adjusted in subclasses by overriding method duplicateInsertion(). The default behaviour is to throw a DuplicateEntryException; it can be modified to either ignore duplicates or overwrite existing entries. There also is a twin class ready which completely ignores duplicates, its name is PwsIgDupRecordList.

    Some Interface Features
    Above plain storage of records and giving a set of records identity, this class offers additional features. a) operations on the content set (merge and set operations, group manipulation), b) mass operating methods, c) buffered database storage (returned objects are clones of the stored objects and stored objects are clones of given objects), d) some semantical control of records validity (optional), e) iterator that allows for concurrent list modification and f) a content signature value. This is a memory borne list, hence the total amount of records databases can hold may be restricted depending on the user's Java runtime environment.

    Event Dispatching
    This class issues modification events which are defined by class PwsFileEvent. Event dispatching occurs synchronous and can be suspended and resumed with method setEventPause(boolean). Mass processing methods, like e.g. addCollection(), undertake effort to only dispatch a single generic list modification event upon termination instead of events for each processed record.

    Synchronisation
    Note this class is not synchronised. If multiple threads need to modify a list instance, they MUST synchronise their activities. Adding and removing of file listeners is synchronised.

    Terminology
    The term "elementary group name" is used in the descriptions. It is defined as a substring of a GROUP value, starting with index 0 and comprising either the total value or ending 1 char before a '.' in the value.

    See Also:
    PwsFile, PwsFileFactory, PwsFileListener, OrderedRecordList

      • PwsRecordList

        public PwsRecordList(DefaultRecordWrapper[] recs)
              throws DuplicateEntryException
        Constructs a new record list with an initial record set as given by the parameter record wrapper array. Duplicate records in the array lead to an exception thrown. No check for record validity is performed. After initialising the alteration state of the list is UNMODIFIED.
        Parameters:
        recs - DefaultRecordWrapper[] record wrapper objects, may be null
        Throws:
        DuplicateEntryException

        Parameters:
        recs - PwsRecord[] record objects, may be null
        Throws:
        DuplicateEntryException

      • duplicateInsertion

        protected boolean duplicateInsertion(PwsRecord rec)
                              throws DuplicateEntryException
        Method called by this class when an attempt is recognised to insert a duplicate of a record into this list. Records are identified by their UUID value. The default reaction is throwing a DuplicateEntryException. The user can modify this reaction in a subclass and, where advantageous, add further activity. Other possible reactions are: returning true means overwrite existing record, returning false means ignore duplicate.
        Parameters:
        rec - PwsRecord duplicate record
        Returns:
        boolean true == overwrite, false == ignore
        Throws:
        DuplicateEntryException

      • addRecordValid

        public void addRecordValid(PwsRecord rec)
                    throws DuplicateEntryException
        Adds a clone of a semantically valid record to this list. The given record has to meet the following conditions for being added: a) returns true on its method "isValid()", b) may not already exist as an entry in this list (Record-ID (UUID) is used for identification). If one of these conditions is not met, the record will not be added and an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        rec - PwsRecord the record to be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the record is not valid
        DuplicateEntryException - if the record already exists in this list
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if parameter is null

      • addRecord

        public void addRecord(PwsRecord rec)
               throws DuplicateEntryException
        Adds a record to this list by creating a clone of the parameter record. The condition for adding the record is that its identification (UUID) may not exist already in this list. This method does not perform any check on semantical validity of the record.
        Parameters:
        rec - PwsRecord the record to be added.
        Throws:
        DuplicateEntryException - if the record already exists
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if parameter is null

      • addRecordIntern

        protected PwsRecord addRecordIntern(PwsRecord rec,
                                    java.lang.String report)
                             throws DuplicateEntryException
        Adds a clone of the parameter record to this list provided its identification is not already contained. Upon successful insertion, the internal stored record instance is returned. This method does not perform any check on semantical validity of the record.

        Note that if the record has not been added due to a duplicate handling setting, null is returned. The return value must not be used to modify the record and not returned to user environment!

        Parameters:
        rec - PwsRecord record to be inserted
        report - String logging marker
        Returns:
        PwsRecord the internal record object or null
        Throws:
        DuplicateEntryException - if record-ID already exists
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if rec is null

      • addRecordList

        public PwsRecordList addRecordList(PwsRecordList list)
                            throws DuplicateEntryException
        Adds a list of records into this record list. The first occurrence of a duplicate entry will break execution of insertion and throw an exception. Does nothing if the parameter is null.

        Note: this does not check for record validity.

        Parameters:
        list - PwsRecordList, may be null
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList, this record list
        Throws:
        DuplicateEntryException

      • addCollection

        public PwsRecordList addCollection(java.util.Collection<PwsRecord> coll)
                            throws DuplicateEntryException
        Adds a collection of records into this record list. The first occurrence of a duplicate entry will break execution of insertion and throw an exception. Does nothing if the parameter is null.

        Note: this does not check for record validity.

        Parameters:
        coll - Collection of PwsRecord, may be null
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList, this record list
        Throws:
        DuplicateEntryException

      • internalIterator

        protected java.util.Iterator<PwsRecord> internalIterator()
        Returns an iterator over the ordered set of elements of this list without inducing the making of clones of the records. This has to be handled with great care!

        Important Notice: Subclasses of PwsRecordList MUST not use the direct references supplied by this iterator to modify the record values or carry them outside of the structure. Otherwise major features of this class are broken.

        Returns:
        Iterator of PwsRecord

      • updateRecordList

        public PwsRecordList updateRecordList(PwsRecordList list)
        Updates a list of records in this record list. Unknown records of the parameter list are not updated and returned in the resulting record list. Does nothing if the parameter is null or the empty list.
        Parameters:
        list - PwsRecordList of records to be updated, may be null
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList subset of parameter list containing records which were not updated, null if empty

      • updateRecordList

        public PwsRecordList updateRecordList(DefaultRecordWrapper[] records)
        Updates a list of records in this record list represented by an array of DefaultRecordWrapper. Duplicate records in the parameter do not cause a problem, the last occurrence counts. Duplicates are not included in the return list.
        Parameters:
        records - DefaultRecordWrapper[] records to be updated, may be null
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList subset of parameter list containing records which were not updated, null if empty

      • updateCollection

        public java.util.List<PwsRecord> updateCollection(java.util.Collection<PwsRecord> coll)
        Updates a collection of records in this record list. Unknown records of the collection are not updated and returned in the resulting record list. Does nothing if the parameter is null or empty.

        Multiple occurrences of a record in the collection are permitted, in which case the last occurrence as given by the collection's iterator is the effective update.

        Parameters:
        coll - Collection of PwsRecord, records to be updated, may be null
        Returns:
        List of PwsRecord, subset of parameter containing records which were not updated, null if there are no such records

      • updateRecord

        public void updateRecord(PwsRecord rec)
                  throws NoSuchRecordException
        Updates an existing record in this list by replacing it with a clone of the parameter record. The record to be updated is identified by its UUID value.

        Note that changes made to record objects obtained from this interface will not strike through to the corresponding list element. Hence the "updateRecord" methods are vital to change an existing record in the list.

        Parameters:
        rec - PwsRecord the record to be updated
        Throws:
        NoSuchRecordException - if the parameter record is unknown
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if parameter is null

      • updateRecordValid

        public void updateRecordValid(PwsRecord rec)
                       throws NoSuchRecordException
        Updates an existing valid record in this list. The record to be updated is identified by its UUID value. If the record is not valid an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        rec - PwsRecord the record to be updated, must be valid
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the record is not valid
        NoSuchRecordException - if the parameter record is unknown
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if parameter is null

public int getRecordCount()

        Returns the total number of records in this list.

        DEPRECATED: Method may get eliminated in future releases. Use size() instead!

      • size

        public int size()

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<PwsRecord> iterator()
        Returns an iterator over all records in the natural order of this list. Records may be deleted from this list by calling the remove() method on the iterator. This iterator returns records that are clones of the filed records; records modified by the user have to be "updated" by use of the updateRecord() method. The iterator allows concurrent modifications of this list.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<PwsRecord>
        Returns:
        Iterator of PwsRecord, iterator over all records (a snapshot of the list situation at the time point of invocation)

      • getUnknownFieldSize

        public long getUnknownFieldSize(int format)
        Returns the total data size of all unknown (non-canonical) fields in this record list. (This refers to blocked data size according to the specified file format.)
        Parameters:
        format - int, the format version of the persistent state to be considered
        Returns:
        long unknown data size

        public void clearUnknownFields()

      • getGrpRecordCount

        public int getGrpRecordCount(java.lang.String group,
                             boolean exact)
        Returns the number of records in this list which belong to the specified group value, including descendant groups. (Note that this function refers to the same set building principle as getGroupedRecords().)
        Parameters:
        group - String GROUP field selection value; may be null
        exact - boolean whether elementary group names must match exactly the parameter
        Returns:
        int number of grouped records as specified

      • getGroupedRecords

        public java.util.Iterator<PwsRecord> getGroupedRecords(java.lang.String group,
                                                       boolean exact)
        Returns an iterator over all records whose group values matches with the parameter value. Two modi operandi are possible: relaxed and exact. In exact mode the parameter value must be identical with an elementary group name in the record group value. In relaxed mode it suffices that the record value starts with the parameter value. Comparison is case sensitive.

        Example: Parameters "AA.Miriam.Car",true will return all records belonging to a group with this name, including all subgroups, but it will not return a record of the "AA.Miriam.Carfesh" group. In relaxed mode the records of the latter group are also returned.

        If group is the empty name, the returned iterator encompasses all records without a group value. If group is null the iterator is empty.

        Records may be deleted from this list by calling the remove() method of the iterator.

        Parameters:
        group - String GROUP field selection value; may be null
        exact - boolean whether elementary group names must match exactly the parameter
        Returns:
        Iterator of PwsRecord

      • getGroup

        public PwsRecordList getGroup(java.lang.String group)
        Returns a record list containing all records belonging to the given GROUP name. If there is no record for this group name, the empty list is returned.
        Parameters:
        group - String selective group name
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList

      • countExpired

        public int countExpired(long date)
        Returns the number of records which are expired on the date given.
        Parameters:
        date - long epoch time-point for this evaluation
        Returns:
        int, number of expired records at date

      • clearInvalidRecs

        public PwsRecordList clearInvalidRecs()

        Whether this database has invalid records.

      • renameGroup

        public PwsRecordList renameGroup(java.lang.String group,
                                 java.lang.String newGroup)
        Renames the GROUP name of a set of records. The set of records is selected by the parameter group name as if through getGroupedRecords(group,true). For each record of the group, the elementary group name part which is defined by group is replaced by the string newGroup.
        Parameters:
        group - String elementary group name (defines a set of records); may be null for no operation
        newGroup - String that replaces the group text in the records' GROUP field; may be null for ""
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList a list of the records actually modified by this operation

      • removeGroup

        public PwsRecordList removeGroup(java.lang.String group)
        Deletes a set of records which is defined by the group parameter. This affects all records which belong to the specified elementary group name, including all descendant groups.

        The set of deleted records is equivalent to getGroupedRecords(group, true).

        Parameters:
        group - String an elementary group name (of the record GROUP field)
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList with set of records removed

      • getGroupList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getGroupList()
        Returns an ordered list of all elementary group names used in this record list. Complex group names are analysed into their elementary group names and all these names included as elements of the list. Ordering follows collation rules of the actual VM default locale. The empty group name is considered a possible element. If this record list is empty, an empty list is returned.
        Returns:
        List of String

      • getGroupList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getGroupList(boolean analyse)
        Returns an ordered list of group names used in this record list. If the parameter is true, complex group names are analysed into their elementary group names and all implied names included as elements of the list. Otherwise only actually assigned group names are included.

        Ordering follows collation rules of the actual VM default locale. The empty group name is considered a possible element. If this record list is empty, an empty list is returned.

        Parameters:
        analyse - boolean true == include implied group names, false == only actually assigned group names
        Returns:
        List of String

      • getGroupCount

        public int getGroupCount()
        Returns the number of distinct and used group names in the file. The empty group name is considered a possible element.
        Returns:
        int number of distinct groups

        Whether this list or any of its records have been modified.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the content of this list has been modified since the last save or load

      • getRecordShallow

        protected PwsRecord getRecordShallow(UUID recID)
        Returns the record with the specified Record-ID as a direct reference to the stored record of this list.

        Important Notice: This method MUST NOT be used to modify the referenced record value or carry it to public. Otherwise major features of this class are broken!

        Parameters:
        recID - UUID Record-ID of the requested record, may be null
        Returns:
        PwsRecord, the requested record or null if such a record is unknown to this list

      • getBlockedDataSize

        public long getBlockedDataSize(int format,
                               java.lang.String charset)
        Returns the size of the data block required to store the content of this record list on a persistent state. (This takes into respect the general file formating rules of a PWS file of the specified format.)
        Parameters:
        format - int, file format version of the persistent state
        charset - String, encoding used for text values
        Returns:
        long required (blocked) data space
        Throws:
        java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException - if charset is unknown to JVM

      • getSignature

        public byte[] getSignature()
        Renders a content signature value for this list of records. Returns a SHA-256 checksum which is a sum-up of all its records' signatures. Note that this value is not individual for a given list instance because two lists with identical records (or empty) will have the same signature value.

        It may not be assumed that this value is identical over different releases of this software but over different sessions of a program running this package.

        Returns:
        byte[] 32 byte signature value (SHA-256 digest)

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all records from this record list.

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Returns a shallow clone of this record list (PwsRecordList). UUID value is the same, File-ID number is modified to be unique and any registered listeners are removed from the clone.

        This class treats record values as constants. Neither does it internally modify referenced record instances, nor does it give the user any opportunity to do this. Because of this feature, the shallow clone of this list is functionally equivalent to a deep clone.

        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Object of type PwsRecordList

      • getInstId

        public int getInstId()
        Returns this list's instance ID value (testing purpose).
        Returns:
        int instance ID, starting from zero

      • copy

        public PwsRecordList copy()
        Returns a clone of this record list with a new UUID value. This works the same as clone() but gives the list a new identity and renders the specific type.
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList

      • replaceFrom

        public void replaceFrom(PwsRecordList a)
        This method replaces the entire content of this record list, including its UUID value, with the content of the parameter record list. Instance ID and file listeners are not replaced!
        Parameters:
        a - PwsRecordList new content and identity for this list

      • replaceContent

        public void replaceContent(PwsRecord[] recs)
                    throws DuplicateEntryException
        Replaces the record content of this list with the parameter set of records. If null or the empty array is given, this works equivalent to clear().

        Note: This adds clones of the records given by the parameter.

        Parameters:
        recs - PwsRecord[], may be null
        Throws:
        DuplicateEntryException

      • setEventPause

        public void setEventPause(boolean value)
        Switch to determine whether file-events will be dispatched from this record list. This may be used to suppress event firing during some operation phases. The default value is false.

        This method issues a LIST_UPDATED event when it switches from state true to state false and the file has been modified during the events-off phase.

        Parameters:
        value - boolean, true means events will be dispatched, false they will not be dispatched

      • getEventPause

        public boolean getEventPause()
        Whether this list object is set to not dispatch file events.
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if this list does not dispatch events

      • moveRecords

        public DefaultRecordWrapper[] moveRecords(DefaultRecordWrapper[] set,
                                          java.lang.String group,
                                          boolean keepPaths)
        Assigns a new GROUP value to a set of records within this record list and in the parameter record wrapper array. Modifies only records which are element of this list. Does nothing if the selection is null or empty.

        The return value is a new array of wrappers which contains all records actually updated. Note this method doesn't list records whose group values have not changed by the requested operation.

        Parameters:
        set - DefaultRecordWrapper[], records to update, may be null
        group - String new value for the GROUP record field (may be null which is equivalent to empty)
        keepPaths - boolean, if true previously existing group values will be appended to the parameter group value
        Returns:
        DefaultRecordWrapper[] list of records actually moved or null if no operation

      • merge

        public PwsRecordList[] merge(PwsRecordList recList,
                             int modus,
                             boolean allowInvalids)
        Merges the parameter record list into this list by optionally considering various conflict handling policies (descriptions see constants of this class). A conflict arises if a record-id is encountered in the parameter list which is also contained in this list AND both records don't share the same set of data. With the modus parameter a set of conflict solving policies can be enabled. If more than one policy is set up, they are conjuncted with logical AND. That means if one of the policies indicates exclusion, the record is excluded.

        Records added or modified by this method receive the transient property "IMPORTED" or "IMPORTED_CONFLICT". A set of returned record lists informs the caller about records which have been excluded, replaced or modified.

        Parameters:
        recList - PwsRecordList the list of records to be added
        modus - int the merge conflict solving policy; policy constants of this class may be combined by adding them; the value 0 is equivalent to MERGE_PLAIN
        allowInvalids - boolean determines whether invalid records of the source are excluded (=false) or considered candidates (=true)
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList[3] index 0 holds all excluded records from the parameter list, index 1 holds all replaced records of this list with their previous content, index 2 holds all new or modified records of this list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if modus value is out of range

      • setImportMarkers

        public void setImportMarkers(int importStatus)
        Set the given IMPORT-STATUS marker on all records of this list.
        Parameters:
        importStatus - int import status (values of PwsRecord)
